message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, decreased skin temperature, and absent pedal pulses suggest peripheral arterial disease (PAD). Cilostazol is a medication that can improve walking distance and reduce symptoms in patients with PAD. Compression stockings may be helpful in cases of venous insufficiency but not PAD. Endarterectomy and bypass surgery may be considered in severe cases of PAD with limb-threatening ischemia, but are not necessary for this patient currently.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest peripheral artery disease, and the absence of pedal pulses indicate severe disease. Cilostazol, a phosphodiesterase inhibitor, is used to improve symptoms and increase walking distance in patients with peripheral artery disease. Compression stockings, endarterectomy and bypass surgery are more invasive interventions and are reserved for patients with more severe or refractory disease.

Cilostazol is a medication used to treat symptoms of intermittent claudication in PAD. Compression stockings and vascular surgeries are other treatment options for PAD, but cilostazol is the most appropriate initial treatment in this patient.
